hints_html: Does \(\sin x\) satisfy the conditions of the Mean Value Theorem on the interval \([0,b]\)? What conclusion can you draw?

hints_raw: Does <math>\sin x</math> satisfy the conditions of the Mean Value Theorem on the interval <math>[0,b]</math>?  What conclusion can you draw?
question: 3 (b)
sols_html:
Because the function \(\sin x\) is continuous on the interval \([0,b]\) and is differentiable on the interval \((0,b)\), we can apply the Mean Value Theorem. Thus we know that there is some \(c\) in the interval \((0,b)\) so that:

\[\begin{aligned} \cos(c) &= \frac{\sin(b) - \sin(0)}{b-0} \\ &= \frac{\sin(b)}{b}\end{aligned}\]
